performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

issue.title: Reduce lock contention in Thread.getAndClearInterrupt

repository.name: openj9-openjdk-jdk
repository.description: Extensions for OpenJDK for Eclipse OpenJ9

issue.body:
Lock contention in `Thread.getAndClearInterrupt` is reduced by
acquiring the lock only when the value of the `Thread.interrupted`
field is `true`.

Related: https://github.com/eclipse-openj9/openj9/issues/20414

timeline_data.body: Ran a 25x grinder: https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/job/Grinder/3965. This failure is intermittent; it failed 6 out of 25 times.
@jasonkatonica This issue is related to the crypto component. Can you take a look at it?

Hello, there was a change to this test at openjdk that looks as follows and no longer has a strict timeout of 150 ( I assume milliseconds ):

https://github.com/openjdk/jdk24u/commit/605396280d5ea225828da4ed688068334a15e122

Most of the test runs done above ( which are no longer available in Jenkins ) were done on Nov 7th or earlier. This update was done at openjdk on Nov 8th.
This issue is no longer observed. No failures were encountered in a 50x Grinder: https://hyc-runtimes-jenkins.swg-devops.com/job/Grinder/46834. Closing this issue.

Yes agreed so far my runs are not failing either with a 100x run https://hyc-runtimes-jenkins.swg-devops.com/job/Grinder/46839/
